intro: Phyllanthus arbuscula, commonly known as the small-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including forests and grasslands. The plant contains latex, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation.
